milestones.title: Initial set-up at NTU (CCEB)
milestones.description: BugBoom started in its initial stages inside the CCEB building at NTU â€” the earliest experiments, sketches and plans for a student-led BSFL farm.

milestones.title: Relocation to City Sprouts @ Henderson
milestones.description: BugBoom moved to City Sprouts @ Henderson. This gave them more space to work with, better soil, and a closer connection to community growers.

milestones.title: Processing coffee grounds from local cafÃ©
milestones.description: First trials processing coffee grounds donated by a neighbourhood coffee shop. Tests focused on larvae performance with real food-waste feedstocks and data collection to refine the process.

milestones.title: First commercial frass produced (test batch)
milestones.description: BugBoom produced its first commercial frass from a donated bag of hawker-centre food waste. Samples were distributed to local farmers and gardeners for feedback â€” an important R&D milestone.

milestones.title: Guest speakers at NTU Entrepreneurship Academy
milestones.description: BugBoom was invited to speak at NTU EA alongside faculty. The team shared lessons on student entrepreneurship, sustainability and turning food waste into value.

milestones.title: Farm fully operational at City Sprouts
milestones.description: With new equipment installed, the City Sprouts farm reached full operational capabilityâ€”allowing higher processing volumes and more reliable frass production.

milestones.title: Site visit â€” BugBoom @ Vidacity
milestones.description: Group 7 visited BugBoom at Vidacity as part of ET5131. We observed operations, interviewed founders, and reflected on the WHY/WHAT/HOW of building purpose-driven ventures.
